column3: Q3 - Can the task — at least theoretically — be done by one individual?
column4: Q4 - Can the task difficulty or complexity be varied systematically?
column5: Q5_1 - For the next few questions answer the degree to which each aspect can be achieved with this task. - There is more than one correct solution
column6: Q5_2 - For the next few questions answer the degree to which each aspect can be achieved with this task. - Correctness of a solution can be demonstrated
column7: Q5_3 - For the next few questions answer the degree to which each aspect can be achieved with this task. - Integrated actions of group members is required
column8: Q5_4 - For the next few questions answer the degree to which each aspect can be achieved with this task. - The task is commonly encountered by members of the society
column9: Q5_5 - For the next few questions answer the degree to which each aspect can be achieved with this task. - Task is interesting and attractive
column10: Q5_6 - For the next few questions answer the degree to which each aspect can be achieved with this task. - Task requires equal participation or effort from group members
column11: Q5_7 - For the next few questions answer the degree to which each aspect can be achieved with this task. - Tasks involve conflict as opposed to cooperation among group members
column12: Q5_8 - For the next few questions answer the degree to which each aspect can be achieved with this task. - The goal of the task is to perform as much or as quickly as possible?
column13: Q5_9 - For the next few questions answer the degree to which each aspect can be achieved with this task. - The goal of the task is to produce a specific desired outcome?
column14: Q6 - What is the ratio of mental to motor effort in this task
column16: Q8 - Does the task require generating an action-oriented plan?
column17: Q9 - Does the task require generating novel ideas?
column18: Q10 - Is there an objectively correct answer?
column19: Q11 - Does this task require resolving differences in viewpoint or opinion?
column20: Q12 - Does this task induce a conflict of interest between the members?
column21: Q13 - Is it against an opponent or adversary group?
column22: Q14 - Can the task be divided into two or more easily separated parts?
column23: Q15 - Does the task require various skills or abilities?
column24: Q16 - Can the group just sum the product of the members’ efforts?
column25: Q17 - Does the task require group members to contribute identically to the group’s product?
column26: Q18 - Can one member’s contribution determine the group’s product?
column27: Q19 - Does it permit the group members to weight contributions in any way they want?
